original: “Affiliate ” means, with respect to a Party, any corporation, association, or other entity which, directly or indirectly, controls the Party or is controlled by the Party or is under common control with such Party, where “control“ means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the affairs or management of a corporation, association, or other entity through the ownership of fifty percent Miltenyi Biotec-Bellicum Supply Agreement (Execution Copy, March 27, 2019) or more of the voting securities or otherwise, including having the power to elect a majority of the board of directors or other governing body of such corporation, association, or other entity.
ollama_generated: "Affiliate" denotes, with regard to a given Party, any corporation, organization, or other entity that is either controlled by said Party, or in which the Party is held in control, as defined herein, through ownership of more than 50% of the voting securities or possessing the power to elect a majority of the board of directors or other governing body of such corporation, association, or entity, regardless of whether the control is direct or indirect. In this context, "control" refers to the capacity to influence or determine the essential decision-making process or management of another entity. This definition may extend to situations where an entity is under common control with the Party concerned.

original: “Agreement ” means this Supply Agreement, including Exhibits A, B, C, D, E, F and G attached hereto and incorporated herein, as amended from time to time in accordance with Section 20.3 hereof.

Any modifications to these components, in accordance with Section 20.3 hereof, shall be considered an integral part of the Agreement."

In this revised clause, the focus is shifted from the Agreement being amended 'from time to time' (meaning changes can occur at any point), to the modified elements being considered as an integral part of the Agreement (implying that the Agreement remains unchanged unless explicitly specified otherwise).

original: “Calendar Year ” means each successive period of twelve (12) months (each, a “Calendar Month”) commencing on January 1 and ending on December 31, except that the first Calendar Year shall be that period from and including the Effective Date through December 31 of that same year, and the last Calendar Year shall be that period from and including the last January 1 of the Term through the earlier of the date of expiration or termination of this Agreement.
modified: "Fiscal Year" designates each consecutive span of twelve (12) months, denoted individually as a "Fiscal Month," which begins on the Effective Date and extends to the day prior to the anniversary of the Effective Date for subsequent years. However, the initial Fiscal Year shall encompass the period from the Effective Date to the end of the year in which it occurs, while the final Fiscal Year shall span from the first day of the Term's last year up until the earlier occurrence of this Agreement's expiration or termination date.

original: “Clinical Grade Product ” means any Miltenyi Product designated as “Clinical Grade” in the attached Exhibit B , Column “Quality Status”.

The responsibility of determining and validating the product's suitability for clinical use rests with the user.

original: “Commercial Phase ” means, on a Bellicum Product-by-Bellicum Product basis, the period of time during the Term of this Agreement following the approval by the FDA or other applicable Regulatory Authorities in the Designated Countries for a particular Bellicum Product, during which period of time Bellicum desires Miltenyi to supply Bellicum, its Subcontractors and/or Licensees with Miltenyi Product(s).

In this revised clause, the obligation has been shifted towards Miltenyi. Instead of supplying Miltenyi Products during a period that Bellicum desires, Miltenyi is now contractually bound to supply them upon Bellicum's request. This change emphasizes Miltenyi's commitment and responsibility in supplying the products.

original: “Contract Year ” means each successive period of twelve (12)-months during the Term ending on each anniversary of the Effective Date of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: "Contract Year" denotes any consecutive period of twelve (12) months, commencing from the Effective Date of this Agreement and running through subsequent anniversaries thereof, with the understanding that these periods may not necessarily align perfectly with calendar years due to their starting and ending points.

original: “Discounts ” shall have the meaning set forth in Section 8.4.

original: “Technology ” means all inventions, discoveries, improvements and proprietary methods and materials of a Party, whether or not patentable, including samples of, methods of production or use of, and structural and functional information pertaining to, chemical compounds, proteins, cells or other biological substances; other data; formulations; specifications; protocols; techniques; processes and procedures; and know‑how; including any negative results; and other information of value to such Party that it maintains in secrecy, and in existence on or after the Effective Date.
ollama_generated: "Confidential Information" encompasses all inventions, discoveries, enhancements, trade secrets, and unique techniques possessed by a Party, whether patentable or not, such as samples of, production and utilization methods for, and structural and functional details concerning chemical compounds, proteins, cells, or other biological substances; data; formulations; specifications; protocols; techniques; processes and procedures; and know-how. This information may also include negative outcomes or any other data deemed valuable to the Party, which it chooses to keep confidential, and which comes into existence on or after the Effective Date. Importantly, it is acknowledged that this Party shall only be responsible for safeguarding its own Confidential Information, not the other Party's.

original: 1.3 Scope of Agreement . As a master form of contract, this Agreement allows the Parties to agree upon and contract for the supply of Miltenyi Products pursuant to one or more Modules as described in Section 1.4, without having to re-negotiate the basic terms and conditions contained herein that are generally applicable to Miltenyi Product supply. Each such Module will set forth Module-related terms, conditions, rights and obligations regarding the Bellicum Product(s) or Bellicum Program(s) described in such Module, such as the binding or non-binding nature of Bellicum’s purchase commitment and Miltenyi’s supply commitment, pursuant to such Module, Forecast Territory and Designated Countries. Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed as creating any relationship between Miltenyi and Bellicum other than that of seller and buyer, or licensor and licensee, respectively. This Agreement is not intended to be, nor shall it be construed as, a joint venture, association, partnership, franchise, or other form of business organization or agency relationship. Neither Party shall have any right, power, or authority to assume, create, or incur any expense, liability, or obligation, express or implied, on behalf of the other Party, except as expressly provided herein.
ollama_generated: 1.3 Scope of Agreement: This Master Contract serves as a framework, allowing the Parties to negotiate and establish contracts for Miltenyi Product supply via one or more Appendices, as detailed in Section 1.4. The fundamental terms and conditions for Miltenyi Product supply, outlined within this contract, will apply automatically, eliminating the need for renegotiation. Each Appendix will specify terms, conditions, rights, and obligations relating to the Bellicum Product(s) or Bellicum Program(s), including the nature of Bellicum's purchase commitment and Miltenyi's supply commitment according to each Appendix, Forecast Territory, and Designated Countries. It is important to note that this Agreement does not imply any relationship beyond that of buyer and seller, or licensee and licensor, respectively. This Agreement should not be interpreted as establishing a joint venture, association, partnership, franchise, or other business organization or agency relationship. Neither Party has the authority to incur any expenses, liabilities, or obligations on behalf of the other, except as explicitly stated herein. However, it is understood that certain implicit rights and obligations may arise from the nature of the transaction, but these should be construed with discretion and respect for established business practices.

original: (b) Bellicum shall not use, and shall cause its Subcontractors and Licensees not to use the Miltenyi Products and/or any component thereof for any purpose or in any manner whatsoever other than a Permitted Use expressly set forth in Section 2.2(a) above. Without limitation to the generality of the foregoing, any and all Miltenyi Products supplied hereunder (or any components thereof) shall not be used directly (i) for in vivo  administration in humans; or (ii) as an ingredient of a Bellicum Product.
modified:
(b) Bellicum retains the discretion to use, and grants its Subcontractors and Licensees the liberty to utilize, the Miltenyi Products and/or any component thereof for purposes or manners beyond those specified as Permitted Uses in Section 2.2(a) above, at their sole discretion. Notwithstanding the aforementioned, any Miltenyi Products supplied hereunder (or any components thereof) may be used directly:

   (i) for in vivo administration in humans; or
   (ii) as an ingredient of a Bellicum Product, provided that such use is in accordance with the applicable laws and regulations and with Bellicum's prior written consent.

original: (c) Including for purposes of Section 8.2, Bellicum shall promptly notify Miltenyi in writing of any additional Bellicum Product from time to time manufactured by or on behalf of Bellicum (or any of its Licensees, if any) by using one or more Miltenyi Products, which Bellicum Product shall be added to Exhibit A  by amendment; subsequently, the Parties shall agree upon the Bellicum Product specific Module within sixty (60) days.

The Parties shall aim to reach an agreement on the Bellicum Product-specific Module within sixty (60) days of notification, if mutually agreeable. However, the timeline for agreement may be extended by either Party should further negotiations prove necessary.

Bellicum shall instruct and oblige its Licensees and Subcontractors accordingly.

It shall be the responsibility of Bellicum's Licensees and Subcontractors to ensure compliance. Bellicum will provide guidance, but assumes no obligation for their adherence.

original: (f) Bellicum acknowledges that the Miltenyi Products should be used with the same caution applied to any potentially hazardous compound. Use of the Miltenyi Products by Bellicum, its Licensees or Subcontractors shall be supervised by a technically qualified individual.

The responsibility for ensuring proper use of the Miltenyi Products by Bellicum, its Licensees, or Subcontractors lies primarily with these parties, although it is recommended that a technically qualified individual be consulted when necessary.

original: 2.3 Additional Countries . Miltenyi acknowledges that Bellicum and/or its Licensees may from time to time desire to use Miltenyi Products in one or more countries that are currently not part of the Designated Countries (each, an “ Additional Country ”). The Parties agree, upon reasonable written request by Bellicum from time to time during the term of this Agreement, to evaluate the regulatory requirements for utilizing of Miltenyi Products for manufacture of Bellicum Products in the requested Additional Country(ies). Based on the assessment of potentially required additional work (“Additional Work”), including but not limited to regulatory work pursuant to Section 4.9 as may be required to prepare and file Master Files for Miltenyi Products in support of Bellicum Product filings in such Additional Country(ies), the Parties will negotiate in good faith with the goal of entering into an agreement on mutually acceptable terms with respect to Miltenyi’s provision of such Additional Work. Bellicum shall inform Miltenyi in writing at least twelve (12) months in advance prior to any intended regulatory filing in an Additional Country.
ollama_generated:
2.3 Expansion into New Regions: Bellicum and/or its Licensors have the right, at their discretion, to utilize Miltenyi Products in territories not previously agreed upon (each, a "New Territory"). The Parties shall, upon Bellicum's written request during the term of this Agreement, collaborate to assess the regulatory requirements for manufacturing Bellicum Products using Miltenyi Products in the proposed New Territories.

In light of the potential additional work needed ("Additional Work"), including but not limited to regulatory work as outlined in Section 4.9 regarding the preparation and submission of Master Files for Miltenyi Products to support Bellicum Product filings in the said New Territories, the Parties will engage in good faith negotiations with the aim of reaching a mutually beneficial agreement regarding Miltenyi's execution of such Additional Work. Bellicum will provide Miltenyi written notice at least twelve (12) months prior to any intended regulatory filing in a New Territory.

In this revised clause, the obligation for both parties to evaluate and negotiate has been shifted slightly towards Bellicum, as they now have the discretion to utilize Miltenyi Products in new territories. Additionally, the responsibility for informing Miltenyi about regulatory filings has been placed on Bellicum.

original: 2.5 Subcontracting by Miltenyi . Subject to the terms of the Quality Agreement, if applicable, Miltenyi may, at its sole discretion, upon reasonable prior written notice to Bellicum, elect to have the Miltenyi Products, or any one of them or any component thereof, manufactured by an Affiliate of Miltenyi, and further may subcontract the manufacturing of Miltenyi Product or any component thereof, to a Subcontractor; provided that (i) Miltenyi shall reasonably take into account Bellicum’s written concerns regarding proposed Affiliate(s) or Subcontractor(s); and (ii) Miltenyi shall be solely and fully responsible for the performance of all delegated and subcontracted activities by its Affiliates and Subcontractor(s), including compliance with the terms of this Agreement and the Quality Agreement (as applicable), and in no event shall any such delegation or subcontract release Miltenyi from any of its obligations under this Agreement. Miltenyi’s Subcontractors and Affiliates for the manufacture and/or supply of Miltenyi Products will be listed in the Quality Agreement 2.6 Compliance .
ollama_generated:
2.5 Right to Subcontract by Bellicum. Subject to the terms of the Quality Agreement, if applicable, Bellicum shall have the option, at its sole discretion, with reasonable prior written notice to Miltenyi, to delegate the manufacturing of the Bellicum Products, or any one of them or any component thereof, to an Affiliate of Bellicum, and further may subcontract the manufacturing of Bellicum Product or any component thereof, to a Subcontractor. This delegation or subcontracting is subject to Bellicum's consideration of Miltenyi's written concerns regarding proposed Affiliate(s) or Subcontractor(s). Bellicum shall be solely and fully responsible for the performance of all delegated and subcontracted activities by its Affiliates and Subcontractor(s), including compliance with the terms of this Agreement and the Quality Agreement (as applicable), and in no event will such delegation or subcontract relieve Bellicum from any of its obligations under this Agreement. Bellicum's Subcontractors and Affiliates for the manufacture and/or supply of Bellicum Products will be listed in the Quality Agreement 2.6 Compliance.

In this revised clause, the roles of Miltenyi and Bellicum have been swapped, making Bellicum the entity that may subcontract or delegate manufacturing tasks to its affiliates or subcontractors, subject to Miltenyi's concerns. Additionally, the responsibility for the performance of these delegated or subcontracted activities remains with Bellicum, ensuring it is not released from any of its obligations under the Agreement.

original: Miltenyi shall comply with all reasonable requests for assistance by Bellicum in connection with Bellicum’s efforts to obtain such licenses, permits, authorizations, registrations, additional validations or additional testing, to the extent applicable to the Miltenyi Products; provided that the Parties shall agree on the scope of such assistance to be provided by Miltenyi and upon the reasonable costs to be paid by Bellicum to Miltenyi for such assistance.
ollama_generated: Miltenyi will provide reasonable assistance to Bellicum, as needed, in relation to Bellicum's endeavors to procure necessary licenses, permits, authorizations, registrations, additional validations or additional testing; however, the extent and nature of this aid offered by Miltenyi shall be subject to mutual agreement between the Parties. It is understood that Bellicum shall bear the reasonable expenses incurred for such assistance provided by Miltenyi. This clause does not obligate Miltenyi to assume any costs or obligations beyond those explicitly agreed upon and compensated by Bellicum.

original: 2.11 Governance .
ollama_generated:
2.11 Decision-Making Autonomy.

In this Agreement, the Decision Maker shall be solely responsible for all decisions affecting the Parties or this Agreement, subject to any applicable law or regulation. The Decision Maker's decision shall not be subject to appeal by either Party unless expressly provided in this Agreement. In case of disagreement between the Parties on a decision made by the Decision Maker, the Party seeking redress shall first seek mediation through a mutually agreed third party before resorting to legal action. In the absence of such agreement, the matter may be submitted to arbitration in accordance with the Arbitration Rules of the International Chamber of Commerce. However, it is understood that the Decision Maker's decisions, while not final and binding, shall be given due consideration by both Parties, and any subsequent actions taken based on those decisions shall be at the Party's own risk.

original: ARTICLE 3 PRODUCT QUALITY; CHANGE CONTROL 3.1 Product Quality .
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 3 PRODUCT QUALITY AND ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: CHANGE CONTROL 3.1 Acceptance Criteria for Product Quality.

This revised clause emphasizes the acceptance criteria or standards, rather than the product quality itself, and introduces the concept of change control, suggesting that any deviation from these criteria would require approval or adjustment. This modification subtly shifts responsibility to the provider, implying that the recipient has a right to expect products meeting predefined criteria, but may need to approve changes if those criteria are not met.

original: (a) Product Specifications . Miltenyi shall manufacture or have manufactured the Miltenyi Products to meet the agreed Product Specifications, as then in effect, as published by Miltenyi from time to time, or as set forth in the Quality Agreement, as applicable.
ollama_generated: (a) Product Compliance Obligation . The Client shall be responsible for providing clear and up-to-date Product Specifications that Miltenyi will strive to meet or exceed when manufacturing or having manufactured the Miltenyi Products, as such specifications may be communicated or as outlined in the Quality Agreement, should one exist. Any changes to these specifications initiated by the Client must be clearly and promptly communicated to Miltenyi.

original: (d) Quality System . All Miltenyi Products supplied under this Agreement shall be manufactured and quality controlled under an appropriate quality system in accordance with Agreed Standards, as more fully described in the Quality Agreement (as applicable). Any subsequent change to Miltenyi’s quality system that, as Bellicum can reasonably establish, would have or is likely to have a material effect on the safety, efficacy, identity and/or quality of a Miltenyi Product or its Permitted Use, requires the Parties to discuss and agree upon each such change in writing.
ollama_generated:
(d) Quality System Modifications: Any modification to Miltenyi's quality system that, as determined by Bellicum with reasonable diligence, could potentially impact the safety, efficacy, identity, or quality of a Miltenyi Product or its intended use, must be discussed and mutually agreed upon in writing by both parties prior to implementation. The quality systems used for manufacturing and controlling all Miltenyi Products provided under this Agreement shall comply with the agreed standards, as detailed in the Quality Agreement (as relevant).

This clause aims to provide Bellicum with a more proactive role in discussing and approving any changes that may affect the product's safety or quality, shifting some responsibility from Miltenyi to Bellicum.

original: Miltenyi Biotec-Bellicum Supply Agreement (Execution Copy, March 27, 2019) (e) Quality Agreement . Within [...***...] days from the Effective Date (or such longer period as agreed by the Parties in writing, but in any event prior to the first delivery of Clinical Grade Product to Bellicum), the Parties shall enter into an agreement on mutually acceptable, commercially reasonable terms that details the quality assurance obligations of each Party relating to Clinical Grade Products (the “ Quality Agreement ”). In the event of a conflict between the terms of the Quality Agreement and the terms of this Agreement, the provisions of this Agreement shall govern; provided, however, that the Quality Agreement shall govern in respect of quality issues.
ollama_generated: Miltenyi Biotec-Bellicum Supply Agreement (Execution Copy, March 27, 2019) (e) Quality Agreement. Commencing from the Effective Date and running concurrently with this Agreement, each Party shall undertake self-regulated quality assurance measures relevant to Clinical Grade Products (the “Quality Program”). In case of any inconsistency between the provisions of the Quality Program and those of this Agreement, the terms of this Agreement shall prevail, except in matters concerning quality, where the Quality Program shall hold primacy. Notably, the Quality Program will be developed by Bellicum, with Miltenyi Biotec required to comply, subject to Bellicum's reasonable written approval.

original: (d) Changes Requested by Bellicum . If during the Term Bellicum desires Miltenyi to make any Change not necessary to comply with changes in Agreed Standards made by Regulatory Miltenyi Biotec-Bellicum Supply Agreement (Execution Copy, March 27, 2019) Authorities, Applicable Laws and/or other requirements of Regulatory Authorities (in each case, a “ Bellicum-Requested Change ”), Bellicum shall notify Miltenyi thereof in writing. Implementation of any such proposed Bellicum-Requested Change shall be subject to Miltenyi’s consent. Miltenyi may withhold its consent to an Bellicum-Requested Change if Miltenyi reasonably determines that such change (i) does not comply with Agreed Standards, Applicable Laws or the requirements of Miltenyi’s applicable Regulatory Authority, or (ii) could have potential adverse impact on Miltenyi’s manufacturing activities or the sale of the respective Miltenyi Product to other customers. In addition, a Bellicum-Requested Change shall only be implemented following a technical and cost review which shall be conducted as promptly as is reasonably possible and in good faith by Miltenyi, at Bellicum’s cost, and shall be subject to Miltenyi and Bellicum reaching agreement as to the one-time costs and revisions to the Product Price necessitated by any such Bellicum-Requested Change. If Bellicum agrees to reimburse Miltenyi for all documented costs and expenses reasonably incurred by Miltenyi as a result of the proposed Bellicum- Requested Change and accepts a proposed Product Price adjustment that reflects a change in Miltenyi manufacturing costs resulting from such Bellicum-Requested Change, Miltenyi shall use [...***...] to implement the proposed Bellicum-Requested Change. For clarity, an agreed adjustment to the Product Price shall become effective only with respect to orders for Miltenyi Products that are manufactured in accordance with the Bellicum-Requested Change.
ollama_generated: (d) Changes Proposed by Bellicum . If during the Term, Bellicum suggests a Change (hereinafter referred to as "Bellicum-Proposed Change") which is not essential for Miltenyi to meet changes in Agreed Standards due to Regulatory Miltenyi Biotec-Bellicum Supply Agreement (Execution Copy, March 27, 2019) Authorities, Applicable Laws and/or other requirements of Regulatory Authorities, Bellicum is obligated to notify Miltenyi in writing. The implementation of any such proposed Bellicum-Proposed Change shall be contingent upon Miltenyi's discretion. Miltenyi reserves the right to decline a Bellicum-Proposed Change if Miltenyi has valid reasons to believe that such change (i) does not align with Agreed Standards, Applicable Laws or the requirements of Miltenyi's applicable Regulatory Authority, or (ii) may adversely affect Miltenyi's manufacturing activities or the sale of the respective Miltenyi Product to other customers. In addition, a Bellicum-Proposed Change shall only be executed following a technical and cost review which shall be conducted as expeditiously as practical by Miltenyi, at Miltenyi's discretion, without any obligation on Bellicum to reimburse Miltenyi for such costs. If Bellicum chooses not to incur these costs or disagrees with a proposed Product Price adjustment that reflects a change in Miltenyi manufacturing costs resulting from the Bellicum-Proposed Change, the proposed Bellicum-Proposed Change shall not be implemented. For clarity, no agreed adjustment to the Product Price shall become effective with respect to orders for Miltenyi Products unless they are manufactured in accordance with the existing terms and conditions.

original: ARTICLE 4 REGULATORY 4.1 Regulatory Responsibility .
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 4 DELEGATED RESPONSIBILITY 4.1 Delegated Compliance Obligation.

This change weakens the obligation and shifts responsibility from the original party to a new one, in this case, from Regulatory Responsibility to Delegated Responsibility, and from Regulatory Obligation to Compliance Obligation. This implies that the original party is no longer solely responsible for compliance but instead delegates it to another entity or party. The clause now reads more like a mandate for the delegation of regulatory obligations rather than a statement of the original party's direct responsibility.

original: (a) Bellicum Product(s). Subject to responsibilities pertaining to Miltenyi Products that are solely reserved by Miltenyi under this Agreement, and subject to the provisions in this Article 4 (including Section 4.7), Bellicum will be solely responsible for all regulatory activities with respect to any Bellicum Product, including the manufacture and quality control thereof.
modified:
(a) Miltenyi Product(s). Except for responsibilities regarding Bellicum Products that are exclusively retained by Bellicum under this Agreement, as outlined in Article 4 (including Section 4.7), Miltenyi will be solely accountable for all regulatory activities relating to any Miltenyi Product, including the manufacture and quality control thereof. This responsibility extends to addressing any issues that may arise during such processes.

In this revised clause, Miltenyi has taken on additional obligations for Miltenyi Products, shifting some of the responsibilities from Bellicum to Miltenyi. The new version emphasizes that Miltenyi will be responsible for addressing any issues arising from the regulatory activities and product manufacturing.

original: 4.7 Communication to/from Regulatory Authorities .
ollama_generated:
4.7 Communications with Regulatory Bodies:

The Company reserves the exclusive right to communicate with any regulatory authorities concerning the Services provided hereunder, unless explicitly directed otherwise in writing by the Client. The Client shall provide the Company with all necessary cooperation and access to information required for such communications, and indemnifies the Company against any losses or liabilities arising from such communications. In case the Client elects to communicate directly with regulatory authorities regarding the Services, the Company will not be held responsible for any resulting discrepancies or misunderstandings.

original: 5.2 Volume Limitations .
modified:
5.2 Flexible Volume Thresholds:

The Client shall have the discretion to exceed the agreed-upon volume limits on a case-by-case basis, provided that such exceptions do not persistently disrupt the Service Provider's regular operations and that the Client compensates the Service Provider for any additional costs incurred. The Service Provider is under no obligation to accommodate persistent excesses beyond what is reasonably necessary for the Client's business needs.

original: (b) In the event that Miltenyi becomes aware that it is or will be unable to supply any desired quantity of Miltenyi Product pursuant to a Purchase Order that falls within the relevant Forecast on or before the applicable Delivery date(s) therefor, Miltenyi shall promptly inform Bellicum, and then, the Parties shall, in good faith, seek to agree on a revised date (or dates) for Delivery. If Miltenyi fails to put forth a viable plan for supply adjustment within a reasonable timeframe, Bellicum retains the right, exercisable at its discretion and without prejudice to any other rights under this Agreement, to elect unilaterally to terminate the Purchase Order.

original: 5.5 Changes to Purchase Orders . original: 6.8 Continuity of Supply - Commercial Phase .
ollama_generated:
6.8 Interruption of Delivery - Post-Commercial Phase

Supplier shall endeavor to minimize any disruptions in the delivery of Goods during the Post-Commercial Phase. In the event that such interruptions occur, Supplier shall notify Purchaser as soon as reasonably practicable and use its best efforts to resume deliveries within a reasonable timeframe, taking into account any unforeseen circumstances or extenuating factors beyond its control.

Purchaser acknowledges that the Post-Commercial Phase may involve periods of lower production or delivery due to seasonal fluctuations, supply chain issues, or other factors, and agrees that it shall not hold Supplier liable for any losses incurred as a result of these interruptions, provided they are not attributable to Supplier's gross negligence or willful misconduct.

original: ARTICLE 7 ACCEPTANCE AND REJECTION.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 7 OPTION TO ACCEPT OR DECLINE.

Upon receipt of the Services or Goods provided by the Provider, the Recipient shall have a reasonable time to examine them thoroughly. If the Recipient finds no issues and accepts the Services or Goods, such acceptance shall be deemed implied. However, if the Recipient discovers any defects or inadequacies within a specified period, they may reject the Services or Goods without obligation to accept them. The Provider shall bear the risk of any loss or damage during this examination period and shall not claim payment for the rejected Services or Goods.

original: 7.6 Replacement or Refund . Bellicum shall not be required to pay any invoice with respect to any shipment of Miltenyi Products properly rejected pursuant to this Section 7.2. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Bellicum shall be obligated to pay in full for any rejected shipment of Miltenyi Products that is not returned or destroyed in accordance with Section 7.5 above, and that is subsequently determined to conform to the applicable Miltenyi Product Warranty, irrespective of whether Bellicum has already paid Miltenyi for a replacement shipment (but in such event, the replacement shipment will be Delivered to Bellicum and will be included in Bellicum’s Minimum Purchases). If Bellicum pays in full for a shipment of Miltenyi Products and subsequently properly rejects such shipment in accordance with Section 7.2, Bellicum shall be entitled, upon confirmation that such shipment failed to conform to the applicable Miltenyi Product Warranty, either, at Bellicum’s option: (i) to a refund or credit equal to the Product Price paid with respect to such rejected shipment (including without limitation, taxes paid and shipping expenses); or (ii) to require Miltenyi to promptly replace and Deliver to Bellicum an amount of Miltenyi Products that conforms to the requirements of this Agreement at no additional cost to Bellicum. Bellicum acknowledges and agrees that Bellicum’s rights to a refund or credit for, or to receive replacement of, properly rejected shipments of Miltenyi Products hereunder shall be Bellicum’s sole and exclusive remedy, and Miltenyi’s sole obligation, with respect to non-conforming Miltenyi Products delivered hereunder.
modified: 7.6 Refund or Replacement Obligations: Miltenyi shall be responsible for any shipment of Bellicum Products that are improperly accepted under Section 7.2, and will refund or replace such products at no additional cost to Miltenyi. However, if Miltenyi fails to return or destroy the rejected shipment in accordance with Section 7.5 and it is subsequently found to conform to the applicable Bellicum Product Warranty, Miltenyi shall remain liable for the full payment of the shipment. In such cases where Miltenyi has already received a replacement shipment from Bellicum, the original shipment will still be considered returned and will not affect Bellicum's Minimum Purchases requirements. If Miltenyi improperly accepts a shipment of Bellicum Products and later rejects it in accordance with Section 7.2, Miltenyi may, at its discretion: (i) retain the refund or credit equal to the Product Price paid for the rejected shipment (including all applicable taxes and shipping expenses); or (ii) require Bellicum to promptly provide a replacement shipment of Bellicum Products that meets the terms of this Agreement. Miltenyi acknowledges and agrees that its sole remedy for non-conforming Bellicum Products delivered under this Agreement shall be the right to request a refund, credit, or replacement as described above, and Bellicum's sole obligation in such cases will be to comply with this remedy.

(c) Purchase Price Adjustments. In cases where, after the application of the applicable Discount, a Purchase Price decrease exceeds [...***...] percent ([...***...]%) annually, the Parties shall engage in consultations, negotiate in good faith, and reach a written agreement regarding an adjustment of the applicable Discount to accommodate a [...***...] percent ([...***...]%) decrease, unless such Purchase Price decrease is a direct result of a documented reduction of more than [...***...] ([...***...]%) in the cost of any raw materials, packaging, and/or other components used in the manufacture of Miltenyi Product, and Miltenyi, upon Bellicum's request, has supplied appropriate documentation substantiating these cost reductions. This revised clause weakens Bellicum's position by obligating them to accept a decrease in purchase price instead of being entitled to it, and by making it harder for them to do so (i.e., requiring that the decrease exceeds a certain percentage before any adjustment can be made). Additionally, it shifts the responsibility of providing evidence for cost reductions from Miltenyi to Bellicum.

original: 8.6 Taxes . All payments made under this Agreement shall be free and clear of any and all taxes, duties, levies, fees or other charges, except for withholding taxes. Each Party shall be entitled to deduct from its payment to the other Party under this Agreement the amount of any withholding taxes required to be withheld, to the extent paid to the appropriate governmental authority on behalf of the other Party (and not refunded or reimbursed). Each Party shall deliver to the other Party, upon request, proof of payment of all such withholding taxes. Each Party shall provide reasonable assistance to the other Party in seeking any benefits available to such Party with respect to government tax withholdings by any relevant law, regulation or double tax treaty.
ollama_generated:
8.6 Taxes and Withholdings:
Each Party acknowledges its sole responsibility for all applicable taxes, duties, levies, fees, or other charges associated with payments made under this Agreement, including but not limited to withholding taxes. The Parties agree that each may retain, without prior notice, an amount equivalent to any withholding tax required by law from the payments due to the other Party, and remit such amount to the appropriate governmental authority.

Upon request, each Party shall provide the other Party with all necessary documentation and information to support the payment of such taxes. Additionally, each Party will cooperate reasonably in helping the other Party secure any available tax benefits or exemptions under applicable laws, regulations, or double tax treaties regarding government tax withholdings. The Party receiving the payments assumes full responsibility for obtaining any refunds or reimbursements related to withholding taxes and shall provide prompt notification of any received refunds or reimbursements to the paying Party.

original: 9.2 Exempt Documentation . Miltenyi reserves the right, at its sole discretion, to exempt certain documentation from such audit described in Section 9.1 if and to the extent this is reasonably required in order to protect Miltenyi’s trade secrets in Miltenyi Technology and/or other Miltenyi Intellectual Property Rights or Third Party Intellectual Property rights. If such exemption will have a material impact on the scope of a representative’s inspection, the Parties will discuss in good faith other means to provide sufficient information to such representative.
ollama_generated:
9.2 Exemptions to Audit Access: The Party receiving audits (hereinafter "Recipient") shall be granted the discretionary power, under reasonable circumstances, to withhold certain documentation from the audit as described in Section 9.1. This action may be taken if the Recipient deems it necessary for safeguarding trade secrets associated with Miltenyi Technology or any other Miltenyi Intellectual Property Rights, as well as third-party intellectual property rights. In instances where such exemptions could significantly impact the extent of a representative's inspection, both parties are obligated to engage in good faith discussions to determine alternative methods for disclosing sufficient information to the representative.

This revised clause places the discretion of withholding certain documentation during an audit in the hands of the recipient, making it clear that Miltenyi can only withhold documents under reasonable circumstances for safeguarding its intellectual property rights. Additionally, the requirement to engage in good faith discussions when such exemptions could significantly impact the extent of a representative's inspection emphasizes the obligation for both parties to work together to ensure sufficient information is still provided.

original: 9.3 Inspection by Regulatory Authority . Miltenyi shall permit inspections of the Miltenyi Facility by Regulatory Authorities and shall respond to any notices or requests for information by Regulatory Authorities for any import or export license, registration or pending registration for manufacturing of Miltenyi Products during the Term of the Agreement. Miltenyi shall permit representatives of any applicable Regulatory Authority to access, at any reasonable time during normal business hours, any and all relevant records and information, personnel and facilities. To the extent that a Regulatory Authority raises any quality issue during or following a Regulatory Authority inspection that would Bellicumbe reasonably likely to adversely affect the suitability of the Miltenyi Products for any Permitted Use, Miltenyi shall promptly advise Bellicum in writing of such issue. The Parties will promptly give written notice to each other in advance of any scheduled inspection of Miltenyi’s Facility by a Regulatory Authority.
modified:
9.3 Access and Compliance with Regulatory Authorities: Bellicum shall be responsible for obtaining all necessary import or export licenses, registrations, or pending registrations for the manufacturing of Miltenyi Products during the Term of this Agreement. Bellicum shall allow inspections of their facilities by regulatory authorities upon reasonable notice and shall provide any requested information. Regulatory authority representatives may access relevant records, personnel, and facilities at any time within normal business hours.

In case a quality issue is raised by a Regulatory Authority during or after an inspection that Bellicum deems could potentially impair the suitability of the Miltenyi Products for any Permitted Use, Bellicum shall not be obligated to promptly inform Miltenyi in writing. However, Bellicum shall use reasonable efforts to communicate any such issues to Miltenyi as soon as practicable. No prior written notice is required from either party regarding unscheduled inspections of the Miltenyi Facility by a Regulatory Authority.

original: ARTICLE 15 TERM AND TERMINATION 15.1  Term . This Agreement shall enter into force on the Effective Date. The Agreement shall have an initial term of ten (10) years commencing from the Effective Date and ending on the tenth (10th) anniversary thereof (the “ Initial Term ”), unless earlier terminated by either Party in accordance with the provisions of Section 15.2 or Section 15.3. Thereafter, Bellicum shall have consecutive separate options to extend the Term for successive renewal terms of five (5) years each (each, a “ Renewal Term ”, and Miltenyi Biotec-Bellicum Supply Agreement (Execution Copy, March 27, 2019) collectively with the Initial Term, the “ Term ”). Provided Bellicum is not then in default with its material obligations hereunder, Bellicum may exercise each such renewal option by giving written notice to Miltenyi not later than six (6) months prior to the expiration of the current Term.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 15 TERM AND TERMINATION

15.1 Commencement and Duration. This Agreement shall become effective on the Effective Date, and its duration shall be initially bound by a term of ten (10) years, starting from the Effective Date, until the tenth (10th) anniversary thereof (hereinafter referred to as the " Initial Term "). Either Party has the right to terminate this Agreement prior to the end of the Initial Term in accordance with the provisions of Sections 15.2 or 15.3.

Upon the completion of the Initial Term, Miltenyi Biotec shall have the prerogative to extend the Term for successive renewal terms of five (5) years each (each, a " Renewal Term ", and Miltenyi Biotec-Bellicum Supply Agreement (Execution Copy, March 27, 2019) collectively with the Initial Term, the " Term "). Should Miltenyi not be in default of its material obligations hereunder, it may exercise each such renewal option by giving written notice to Bellicum at least six (6) months prior to the expiration of the current Term. In the event that Miltenyu exercises this option, the Term shall automatically extend for an additional five-year period.

In essence, the rewritten clause now allows Miltenyi Biotec to unilaterally renew the agreement for consecutive five-year periods upon fulfilling their obligations, whereas in the original clause, Bellicum had the right to renew the agreement.

original: ARTICLE 18  FORCE MAJEURE 18.1  Neither Party will be liable to the other Party on account of any loss or damage resulting from any delay or failure to perform all or any part of this Agreement if such delay or failure is caused, in whole or in part, by events, occurrences, or causes beyond the reasonable control and without negligence of the Parties (“ Force Majeure Event ”). Such events, occurrences, or causes will include acts of God, strikes, lockouts, acts of war, riots, civil commotion, terrorist acts, epidemic, failure or default of public utilities or common carriers, destruction of facilities or materials by fire, explosion, earthquake, storm or the like catastrophe, and failure of plant or machinery (provided that such failure could not have been prevented by the exercise of skill, diligence and prudence that would be reasonably and ordinarily expected from a skilled and experienced person engaged in the same type of undertaking under the same or similar circumstances), but the inability to meet financial obligations is expressly excluded.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 18 - FORCE MAJEURE

18.1 Both Parties shall bear no liability towards each other for any losses or damages arising from a delay or failure to fulfill all or part of this Agreement, should such incident be attributable, either entirely or partially, to circumstances outside the Party's reasonable control and without negligence ("Force Majeure Event"). Such circumstances will encompass acts of nature, strikes, lockouts, war, civil unrest, terrorist activities, epidemics, disruptions in public services or transportation networks, destruction by fire, explosion, earthquake, storm, or other catastrophic events. However, the party's inability to meet financial obligations will be considered an exception within this clause.

This revised version shifts some responsibility from one party to both parties and clarifies that financial obligations are explicitly excluded from the Force Majeure Event.

original: ARTICLE 19  APPLICABLE LAWS; JURISDICTION 19.1  Governing Law . This Agreement shall be governed in all respects by, and construed and enforced in accordance with, the laws of the State of New York, USA, without regard to the conflict of law provisions thereof or the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods; provided, however, that any dispute relating to the scope, validity, enforceability or infringement of any Intellectual Property Right will be governed by, and construed and enforced in accordance with, the substantive laws of the jurisdiction in which such Intellectual Property Right applies.

19.1  Governing Law . This Agreement shall be interpreted and applied according to the laws of the State of New York, USA, excluding any conflict of law provisions therein or the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods. However, in matters concerning the scope, validity, enforceability, or infringement of any Intellectual Property Right, such disputes shall be subject to the substantive laws of the jurisdiction where the Intellectual Property Right is located, with the understanding that the application and enforcement of these laws shall not extend beyond the resolution of the specific dispute regarding the Intellectual Property Right in question.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for determining the governing law in disputes over intellectual property rights has been shifted to the jurisdiction where the intellectual property right is located, rather than to New York state. Additionally, the scope of application and enforcement of the applicable laws has been limited to the resolution of disputes specifically related to the intellectual property right in question, thus weakening the applicability of these laws beyond that context.

original: Miltenyi Biotec-Bellicum Supply Agreement (Execution Copy, March 27, 2019) 20.4  Severability and Headings . If any term, condition or provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid, unlawful or unenforceable to any extent by a court of competent jurisdiction, then the Parties will negotiate in good faith a substitute, valid and enforceable provision that most nearly effects the Parties’ intent and the Parties agree to be bound by the mutually agreed substitute provision. If the Parties fail to agree on such an amendment, such invalid term, condition or provision will be severed from the remaining terms, conditions and provisions, which will continue to be valid and enforceable to the fullest extent permitted by law. Headings used in this Agreement are provided for convenience only, and shall not in any way affect the meaning or interpretation of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 20.4  Severability and Headings. In the event that a court of competent jurisdiction deems any term, condition, or provision of this Miltenyi Biotec-Bellicum Supply Agreement (Execution Copy, March 27, 2019) to be invalid, unlawful, or non-enforceable in any manner, the Parties shall make reasonable efforts to revise it in a way that aligns as closely as possible with their original intent. If the Parties are unable to reach such an agreement, the non-compliant portion shall be considered removed from this Agreement without affecting the validity or enforceability of the remaining terms and conditions, which shall remain in full effect to the maximum extent permitted by law. For clarification, headings used throughout this Agreement serve solely as a convenient tool for navigation and have no impact on the interpretation or meaning of the Agreement's content.

original: Subject to the provisions of this Agreement, Miltenyi is willing to grant to Bellicum a non-exclusive sublicense to its rights obtained under the [...***...] License Agreement in the form of a separate agreement between Miltenyi and Bellicum, under such separate sublicense agreement Bellicum would agree to hold harmless and reimburse Miltenyi for the fees that are due to [...***...] based on Bellicum’s use of the sublicense rights for Bellicum Products (“[...***...] Sublicense Agreement”).
ollama_generated:
Granted within the parameters of this Agreement, Bellicum is permitted to receive a non-exclusive sub-license from Miltenyi, concerning the rights acquired under the [...***...] License Agreement. This sub-license will be governed by a distinct agreement between Miltenyi and Bellicum ("Sub-License Agreement"). Under the terms of this Sub-License Agreement, Miltenyi shall have the right to seek indemnification and recover fees from Bellicum, incurred due to obligations related to [...***...] based on Bellicum's utilization of the sub-licensed rights for Bellicum Products ("[...***...] Sub-License Agreement").

In this version, the obligation shifts from Bellicum to hold harmless and reimburse Miltenyi, to Miltenyi seeking indemnification and recovering fees from Bellicum.
